SEARCH
Module org.microbean.bean
Package org.microbean.bean

Interface Creation<I>

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultCreation
public interface Creation<I> extends AutoCloseable, Cloneable
A representation of a Factory's creation activity.

Most Creation implementations will, and should, also be AutoCloseableRegistry implementations. See DefaultCreation as one arbitrary example.

Author:
Laird Nelson

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    BeanSelectionCriteria
    beanSelectionCriteria()
    Returns the BeanSelectionCriteria that is in effect (and that is the reason for which this Creation has been created), if known, or null if not.
    default <J> Creation<J>
    cast()
    Casts this Creation to the inferred return type and returns it.
    static <I> Creation<I>
    cast(Creation<?> c)
    Casts the supplied Creation to the inferred return type and returns it.
    Creation<I>
    clone(BeanSelectionCriteria beanSelectionCriteria)
    Clones this Creation such that the resulting clone will return the supplied BeanSelectionCriteria from any invocation of its beanSelectionCriteria() method, and, critically, if this Creation implementation implements AutoCloseableRegistry, arranges to have the resulting clone registered with its immediate ancestor (this Creation) such that closing the ancestor (this Creation) will also close the clone.
    void
    close()
    Closes this Creation, and, if this Creation implementation implements AutoCloseableRegistry, any clones that were registered with it.
    default void
    created(I instance)
    Signals that the supplied instance has been created and is about to be made available for use.

  • Method Details

    • beanSelectionCriteria

      BeanSelectionCriteria beanSelectionCriteria()
      Returns the BeanSelectionCriteria that is in effect (and that is the reason for which this Creation has been created), if known, or null if not.
      Returns:
      the BeanSelectionCriteria that is in effect, or null
      Nullability:
      Implementations of this method may return null.

    • clone

      Creation<I> clone(BeanSelectionCriteria beanSelectionCriteria)
      Clones this Creation such that the resulting clone will return the supplied BeanSelectionCriteria from any invocation of its beanSelectionCriteria() method, and, critically, if this Creation implementation implements AutoCloseableRegistry, arranges to have the resulting clone registered with its immediate ancestor (this Creation) such that closing the ancestor (this Creation) will also close the clone.

      If an implementation of this method does not adhere to these requirements, undefined behavior, and possibly memory leaks, will occur.

      Parameters:
      beanSelectionCriteria - the BeanSelectionCriteria that is the reason for which the resulting clone is being requested; may be null
      Returns:
      a clone of this Creation; never null
      See Also:
      • beanSelectionCriteria()
      • close()
      • AutoCloseableRegistry
      • AutoCloseableRegistry.register(AutoCloseable)
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • close

      void close()
      Closes this Creation, and, if this Creation implementation implements AutoCloseableRegistry, any clones that were registered with it.

      Factory implementations (and other user-authored code) normally should not invoke this method, and indeed doing so may result in undefined behavior and/or an IllegalStateException being thrown.

      Invoking this method during actual creation may cause undefined behavior and/or an IllegalStateException to be thrown.

      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if it is not legal yet to close this Creation
      See Also:
      • clone(BeanSelectionCriteria)
      • AutoCloseableRegistry
      Idempotency:
      Implementations of this method must be idempotent.
      Thread Safety:
      Implementations of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • cast

      default <J> Creation<J> cast()
      Casts this Creation to the inferred return type and returns it.

      Overrides of this default method must return this Creation cast to the apppropriate type. Any other return value will result in undefined behavior.

      Returns:
      this Creation, cast to an appropriate type; never null
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the cast could not be performed for any reason

    • created

      default void created(I instance)
      Signals that the supplied instance has been created and is about to be made available for use.

      This method is typically invoked from within a Factory.create(Creation, ReferenceSelector) implementation immediately prior to its returning a value.

      The default implementation of this method does nothing.

      Parameters:
      instance - the instance that was created; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if instance was null
      IllegalArgumentException - if instance was found to be unsuitable for any reason
      Idempotency:
      Overrides of this method must be idempotent.
      Thread Safety:
      Overrides of this method must be safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • cast

      static <I> Creation<I> cast(Creation<?> c)
      Casts the supplied Creation to the inferred return type and returns it.
      Parameters:
      c - the Creation to cast and return; may be null
      Returns:
      the Creation, cast to an appropriate type, or null
